data.title: Worldwar Upsetting Balance by Harry Turtledove
data.meta_description: Worldwar: Upsetting the Balance by Harry Turtledove and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Condition: Very Good. Shipped within 24 hours from our UK warehouse. Clean, undamaged book with no damage to pages and minimal wear to the cover. Spine still tight, in very good condition. Remember if you are not happy, you are covered by our 100% money back guarantee.

Condition: New. Harry Turtledove is the award-winning author of the alternate-history works The Man with the Iron Heart, The Guns of the South, and How Few Remain (winner of the Sidewise Award for Best Novel) the Hot War books: Bombs Away, Fallout,.

Condition: good. 100% Customer Satisfaction Guaranteed ! The book shows some signs of wear from use but is a good readable copy. Cover in excellent condition. Binding tight. Pages in great shape, no tears. Not contain access codes, cd, DVD.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. No Jacket. Uncorrected proof. SIGNED by the author. Minor shelf and handling wear, overall a clean solid copy with minimal signs of use. *** Signed by author, Harry Turtledove *** Pages are clean. Binding is tight. Secure packaging for safe delivery. 1.85. signed by author.

Octavo, cloth-backed boards. First edition. Third book of a four-volume alternate history series set during World War II, preceded by WORLDWAR: IN THE BALANCE and WORLDWAR: TILTING THE BALANCE. A fine copy in fine dust jacket. (#104316).

Octavo, cloth-backed boards. First edition. Third book of a four-volume alternate history series set during World War II, preceded by WORLDWAR: IN THE BALANCE and WORLDWAR: TILTING THE BALANCE. A fine copy in fine dust jacket. (#169529).

(1996). First edition. SIGNED by the author to the title-page. Previous owner's blind stamp to front free endsheet, else a fine copy, in a mildly age-toned, otherwise fine, illustrated dust jacket. Jacket painting by Stan Watts. Book Three in Turtledove's quartet of novels imagining a very different WWII. "Does a grand job of bringing to life any number of famous historical personages and illuminates them considerably by plunging them into this bizarre situation."--Gahan Wilson.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1ST. An Excellent Copy - Signed By The Author On The Title Page. A First Edition, First Printing. Book Is In Near Fine Condition. Boards Are Clean, Not Bumped. Fore Edges Have A Tiny Bit Of Shelf Wear. Interior Is Clean And Legible. Not Remaindered. Dust Jacket Is In Near Fine Condition. Not Chipped Or Crinkled. Not Price Clipped. Dust Jacket Is Covered By Mylar Brodart. Thanks And Enjoy. Signed by Author(s). Book.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First edition. 481pp. Fine in a very good tape-repaired dustwrapper with tiny scratches to panels, shallow tears to the front flap fold, edge wear. Book three of the *Worldwar* series.

First edition. Octavo, cloth backed boards. The third book of the first four volume series of an alternate history in which an alien invasion takes place during World War II. Anatomy of Wonder (2004) II-1151. A fine copy in a fine dust jacket. (27097).

Mass Market Paperback. Condition: Very Good. First Thus. New York: Del Rey / Ballantine Books [1996]. Very Good. 1996. First Thus. Mass Market Paperback. 0345402405 . First edition thus. Alternate history novel. 530 pages. VG copy [spine cocked with light wear to the front edge, bumping to the rear of the book along the bottom edge, cheap text paper tanning] with a remainder-like line to the top edge. .
